genericOIDC.providerIdHint: Unique identifier for this provider (lowercase, no spaces)

setupGuide.title: Setup Guide
setupGuide.description: Check the OAuth2 application registration guide for each provider.

encryptionKey.title: SSO Encryption Key
encryptionKey.description: To use SSO, you must first generate an encryption key and set it in your .env file. This key is used to securely store OAuth2 client secrets.

instructions.title: Next Steps:
instructions.step2: Open your .env file and add SSO_ENCRYPTION_KEY=generated-key

ssoGuide.title: SSO Setup Guide
ssoGuide.description: OAuth2 application registration guide for each provider.

step1.title: 1. Configure Redirect URI
step1.description: You must enter the Redirect URI exactly in each Provider's OAuth2 application settings. Replace 'your-domain' with your actual domain or IP address.

step2.title: 2. Copy Client ID and Secret
step2.description: Copy the Client ID and Client Secret generated by the Provider and enter them in the SSO settings page.

step3.title: 3. Enable
step3.description: After entering all information, enable the Provider and the corresponding button will appear on the login page.

ssoGuide.replaceYourDomain: Replace 'your-domain' with your actual domain or IP address. Use HTTPS example when using NPM (Nginx Proxy Manager).
ssoGuide.replaceSynologyDomain: Replace 'your-synology-domain' with your actual Synology domain (e.g., dsm.example.com)
ssoGuide.autoRedirectUri: Redirect URIs below are automatically set to the current server address.
ssoGuide.synologyWellKnown: Synology Well-known URL (Copy from SSO Server):

google: Add authorized redirect URIs: See Redirect URI section below (HTTP or HTTPS)
Copy Client ID and Client Secret to SSO settings
microsoft: Go to Microsoft Entra admin center (entra.microsoft.com)
âš ï¸ Entra ID account required (free account available)
Supported account types: "Accounts in this organizational directory only" (Single tenant)
Redirect URI: Select "Web" platform and enter Redirect URI below
Enter description (e.g., VDTN SSO), select expiration period
Copy the secret "Value" (âš ï¸ shown only once)
Enter Client ID and Client Secret in VDTN SSO settings
github: Go to Settings > Developer settings > OAuth Apps
Homepage URL: Enter your server address
Authorization callback URL: See Redirect URI section below
Generate Client ID and Client Secret for SSO settings
synology: Sign in to Synology DSM as administrator
Install "SSO Server" package from Package Center
Select "Enable OIDC server" and save settings
Redirect URI: See Redirect URI section below
Use "Synology DSM" section in VDTN SSO settings
Enter Client ID (Application ID) and Client Secret (Application Secret)
Enter Discovery URL (Well-known URL) - see below
authentik: Redirect URIs: See Redirect URI section below
Click "Create" and copy Client ID and Client Secret
Name: VDTN, Slug: vdtn, Provider: Select the provider created above
Enter Client ID and Client Secret in VDTN SSO settings
Discovery URL: See Discovery URL section below
genericOIDC: Find your SSO provider's OpenID Connect Discovery URL
Create a new OAuth2/OIDC application in your SSO provider's admin console
Register the Redirect URI with the value shown below
Obtain the Client ID and Client Secret
Click "Add Generic OIDC Provider" in VDTN SSO settings page
Provider ID: Enter a unique identifier (e.g., keycloak, custom-sso)
Display Name: Enter the name to show on login button
Enter Client ID and Client Secret
Enable the added provider to show the login button

issue1.title: Redirect URI Mismatch Error
issue1.solution: Verify that the Redirect URI in the Provider settings exactly matches the one in SSO settings. Protocol (http/https) and port number must all match.

issue2.title: Client Secret Error
issue2.solution: Check if the SSO encryption key (SSO_ENCRYPTION_KEY) is correctly set in the .env file. If you changed the key, you must restart the containers.

issue3.title: Error After Login
issue3.solution: Verify that the Scopes requested from the Provider are correctly configured. Some Providers may require additional permission approvals.

apiTokens.info: API tokens allow external applications (Telegram bots, browser extensions) to authenticate without using your password. Each token can be revoked independently.
apiTokens.noTokens: No API tokens yet. Create one to get started.
apiTokens.tokenNamePlaceholder: e.g., My Telegram Bot, Chrome Extension
apiTokens.createDescription: Give your token a descriptive name to remember where it's used.
apiTokens.tokenCreatedWarning: Copy this token now. You won't be able to see it again!
apiTokens.configUrlDescription: Copy this URL for browser extensions or Telegram bots. It contains both server address and token.
apiTokens.apiTokenDescription: Use this token with your Username in browser extensions or Telegram bots.
apiTokens.method1Description: Works for both extensions and Telegram bots. Just copy the URL!
apiTokens.method2Description: Works for both extensions and Telegram bots. Enter Username and token above
apiTokens.method3Description: Works for both extensions and Telegram bots. Legacy method (not recommended for security)
apiTokens.confirmRevoke: Are you sure you want to revoke the token "{{name}}"? Applications using this token will no longer be able to authenticate.

rolePermissions.description: Configure default permissions for each role. Individual users can be granted exception permissions.
